I saw several customers buy a reusable Target bag. Many others had one already.

But I didn't see a single customer rent a Goatote bag.

A sales associate told me few people use the bag rental system, and only when the store runs out of Target bags.

The display was 20 feet away from the $1.00 bag rental station. Target was *selling* reusable bags for $.99.

No account was required. You just bought the bag. https://t.co/iOTWtuZwJ4

This was getting to be way too much effort for a $1.00 shopping bag rental.

And then I saw this...

The privacy policy is also quite long. It clocks in at 3,796 words.

I had no idea so many privacy issues could arise from renting a shopping bag!

The Terms of Service link takes you to a generic page for a seemingly unrelated company.

I searched, but could not find the Terms of Service. No support was immediately available. https://t.co/yoX6aY1e9m

There's a sign and a rental kiosk next to one of the self-checkout areas.

Bag rentals are $1.00 per use, or you can rent unlimited bags for $2.50 per month.
